programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: When “Boxcar Bertha” and “Bloody Mama” took a trip to “Hollywood Boulevard,” they told some car thieves to “Eat My Dust,” and drove off like they were extras in “Death Race 2000.”

programme.title: Remembering Romero
programme.desc: Looking back at the iconic films of horror director George A. Romero.

programme.title: Scorsese, Leone, and Larry Cohen
programme.desc: Three directors. Three unique styles. Three incredible legacies.

programme.title: Friedkin, De Palma, and Carpenter
programme.desc: Take a closer look at the classic films of William Friedkin, Brian De Palma, and John Carpenter.

programme.title: You Don't Know Jack Hill
programme.desc: A legend in the exploitation genre, these are the films that define director Jack Hill's career.

programme.title: The Diary of David Cronenberg
programme.desc: Take a look at the bizarre body horror and sci-fi films of director David Cronenberg.

programme.title: Stephen King Stories and Decoding David Lynch
programme.desc: From Carrie to Eraserhead and beyond, Stephen King and David Lynch have defined cinematic storytelling for decades.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1940s Vol. 1
programme.desc: Your favorite filmmakers explore the eerie classics that defined a decade of supernatural thrills and monster madness.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1940s Vol. 2
programme.desc: These 1940s horror films define the decade's fascination with the supernatural and monstrous.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1970s Vol. 1
programme.desc: Enter the realm of 1970s horror, featuring vampiric tales, psychological terror, and innovative creature features.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1970s Vol. 2
programme.desc: Explore the grittier side of 1970s horror with a collection of gruesome tales that push the boundaries of blood and mayhem.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1970s Vol. 3
programme.desc: Experience the unsettling horror of the 1970s, featuring a mix of psychological tension, supernatural dread, and iconic cult films.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1970s Vol. 4
programme.desc: From supernatural chillers to psychological thrillers, few decades can match the 70s when it comes to horror.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1970s Vol. 5
programme.desc: These 70s horror hits blend iconic slashers, cult classics, and supernatural threats with an atmosphere of terror and paranoia.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1980s Vol. 1
programme.desc: The 1980s delivered a brutal mix of slashers, supernatural terrors, and campy thrills that left a lasting mark on the genre.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1980s Vol. 2
programme.desc: Showcasing the genre's evolving creativity and daring vision, the 1980s delivered a diverse mix of gritty slashers and supernatural chills.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1980s Vol. 3
programme.desc: Exploring the darker side of the 1980s, this collection delves into chilling tales of possession, alien encounters, and psychological horror that pushed the boundaries of the genre.

programme.title: Decades of Horror: 1990s
programme.desc: From innovative horror to psychological thrills with supernatural elements, these 1990s films redefined the genre.

programme.title: Here Comes Frankenstein!
programme.desc: Your favorite filmmakers examine the history of the Frankenstein monster on screen!

programme.title: Jesse James Meets Frankensteins Daughter
programme.desc: The infamous outlaw Jesse James crosses paths with Dr. Frankenstein's murderous granddaughter, Maria.

programme.title: Karloff: The King of Horror
programme.desc: Boris Karloff's portrayal of monsters and villains made him the undisputed king of 20th century horror.

programme.title: Monsters & Misfits: The Legacy of Lon Chaney Jr.
programme.desc: Celebrate Lon Chaney Jr.’s big screen legacy of classic creatures and complex misfits.

programme.title: Dracula and the Hollywood Vampires
programme.desc: The legendary Count Dracula inspires a bevy of onscreen bloodsuckers!

programme.title: Nosferatu
programme.desc: In director F.W. Murnau’s unauthorized adaptation of Bram Stoker’s 1897 novel Dracula, vampire Count Orlock (Max Schreck) leaves Transylvania in search of a young woman, Ellen Hutter (Greta Schroder), while evading her husband, Thomas (Gustav von Wangenheim), and the Van Helsing-esque Professor Bulwer (Gustav Botz). A monumental achievement in German Expressionism, Nosferatu is revered as one of the most influential horror films of all time.

programme.title: Bela Lugosi Beyond Dracula
programme.desc: From monster mashups and horror hijinks, Bela Lugosi was much more than cinema’s greatest vampire.

programme.title: Bela Lugosi Meets Brooklyn Gorilla
programme.desc: Bela Lugosi is conducting horrific experiments on a jungle island. This won't end well.

programme.title: Mummies, Werewolves, and More Monsters!
programme.desc: From the tombs of Egypt to the Paris Opera House, the monsters are on the loose!

programme.title: The Ape Man
programme.desc: Bela Lugosi should have known better than to use his experimental ape man formula on himself. Now things are getting really hairy.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: Universal Horror Volume 1

programme.title: Christopher Lee: From Fangs to Frights
programme.desc: From Hammer hits to Corman classics and more, these movies made Christopher Lee a horror icon.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: Your favorite filmmakers take you inside Britain's iconic Hammer Film factory.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: Take a journey into the heart of Hammer horror with today's top filmmakers.

programme.title: Horror Express
programme.desc: Passengers aboard a Trans-Siberian Express train must fight to stay alive after a prehistoric creature escapes captivity and begins a murder spree.

programme.title: Vincent Price: Master of the Silver Scream
programme.desc: From 'Haunted Hill' to Corman classics, Vincent Price sent shivers down the spines of horror fans for decades.
